definition: to err/to get sth wrong/to miscalculate/to misunderstand
lane/alley
to do/to manage/to handle/to play with/to fool with/to mess with/to fix/to toy with
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
surname Cuo

sentences.english: She gets pretty drunk and stumbles home in the wrong direction.
sentences.chinese: 她很醉，跌跌撞撞的回家，卻弄錯了方向。

sentences.english: E. g. I don't always tell them that they've made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我並不總是同他們說他們弄錯了。

sentences.english: 'You're mistaken I daresay. It's no matter.
sentences.chinese: 我想是你弄錯了，這不要緊。

sentences.english: There is no excuse for misidentifying a letter.
sentences.chinese: 沒有藉口弄錯一個字母。

sentences.english: Even today, the influence of the heavens on the days of the week is unmistakable.
sentences.chinese: 即使今天也不會有人弄錯天體對一週內的七天的影響。

sentences.english: I’ll get you the right order.Sorry about the mix-up.
sentences.chinese: 我去給您拿您點的菜，對不起我們弄錯了。

sentences.english: When I wrote this code, I messed this trivial method up twice.
sentences.chinese: 在編寫代碼時，我兩次都弄錯了這個簡單的方法。

sentences.english: If I am not mistaken, BMW used to be famous for its 6-cylinder engine.
sentences.chinese: 如果我沒弄錯的話，寶馬以前的6缸引擎很出名。

sentences.english: He got the meeting time wrong this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上他把開會時間弄錯了。

sentences.english: She blundered when she added up the bill.
sentences.chinese: 她把賬款相加時弄錯了。

sentences.english: Lord, make it clear to me!

sentences.chinese: 好吧，不過最好你不要弄錯了。

sentences.english: Sometimes, the airport will lose or mishandle your baggage.
sentences.chinese: 有時候機場人員會把你的行李弄丟或弄錯。

sentences.english: He mentioned this to his wife and conjectured aloud that the artist must have made a mistake.
sentences.chinese: 費希向他太太提出這點，並縱聲猜測雕塑家弄錯了。

sentences.english: We've made a mistake in translating the Newzealand in the mail, very sorry.
sentences.chinese: 郵件中地新西蘭，是我們的翻譯弄錯了，真對不起。

sentences.english: I'm sorry. I made a mistake.

definition: mistake/to make a mistake/to blunder/mistaken
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
fortunately/luckily
not in good condition/wrong/fishy
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
incorrect/wrong/amiss/abnormal/queer
to tell the truth/to tell it as it is
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
and so on/and such
there is nothing to be done/one can't do anything about it
son of the boss/young master of the house/your son (honorific)
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
ambiguity/several possible meanings
to be confused/to be baffled
